DataElement.preferredName: Cytogenetic Abnormality Monosomy Chromosome 17 Present Checkbox Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator determining whether or not there was a Monosomy 17/Deletion 17p result.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material._A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the absence of one chromosome from the normal diploid number._The designation for each member of the seventeenth largest human autosomal chromosome pair. Chromosome 17 spans more than 81 million base pairs and represents between 2.5 and 3% of the total DNA in normal diploid cells._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Concepts.definition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Property.preferredDefinition: The condition in which one chromosome of a pair is missing. In a normally diploid cell it is represented symbolically as 2N-1.:The designation for each member of the seventeenth largest human autosomal chromosome pair. Chromosome 17 spans more than 81 million base pairs and represents between 2.5 and 3% of the total DNA in normal diploid cells.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the absence of one chromosome from the normal diploid number.

The designation for each member of the seventeenth largest human autosomal chromosome pair. Chromosome 17 spans more than 81 million base pairs and represents between 2.5 and 3% of the total DNA in normal diploid cells.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/17/15: Released/tt_Updated with chromosome number def. AK 4/29/11 5/11/11: changed the concepts order.wz

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator determining determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
